column3: â€œthis review was written under the influence of Balmoral. The high is nice and mellow without being overpowering. The taste is cheesy with earthy notes. I smoked this strain for depression and social anxiety and I feel more relaxed and my head is clear. this is is the strain if you just want relax and not get to stoned to functionâ€

â€œThis pressed beautifully into rosin with a high output. Pretty stinky (cheesy) with a decent high and relaxing effect- definitely a good balance between indica and sativa with this one. Acquired from Tweed's THC collector's pack.â€

â€œThe UK cheese background of that strain gives it a musty odor and the smooth taste of a fine indoor strain. The effets are a bit strong as this is 19.7% thc. Very focused high, strong couchlock effect.â€

â€œIt says it supposed to be good for pain. However I smoked it during my menstrual cramps and it didn't do much for the pain. :(((( 

When I wasn't in pain it gave me an nice light head buzz, but nothing impressive. ğŸ‘ğŸ¼â€

â€œGot it from sqdc in montreal balmoral by tweed its knock off of a uk cheese

1 smells really good
2 tastes cheesy skunky but smooth
3 Buzz is super potent 
4 tiny buds and really dry turns to dust when you crumble it
5 I recommend itâ€

â€œTHC content is good.  I give it to them.

But taste wise..... It taste pretty bad.  No cheese flavor, nothing.  Smooth but there is a strange flavor when I smoke it.  Tweed flavor should I say?

Product is dried. Not bone dried.  It doesn't crumble when you squeeze it. But more on the dried side. 

If you don't care much about taste but potency only, this is a great product.  

I am too much of a connoisseur that I c...â€

â€œTaste: Pleasant,Earthy,Pine
Smokes : Smooth
High: Uplifting, Happy, Long Lasting
Cons: Dry Mouth
Outcome: Will Buy Againâ€
â€œthis strain gives me a hyperslice of soothing atrophy... one of my new favs.â€
â€œMeh, maybe Tweed should try some different phenotypes.â€
